abstract: The elderly often undergo operations in their final year, a new analysis finds.
snippet: The elderly often undergo operations in their final year, a new analysis finds.
lead_paragraph: The Times reports today on a study finding that surgery is surprisingly common in older people during the last year, month and even week of life, a finding that is likely to stoke, but not resolve, the debate over whether patients are being overtreated.

headline.main: Surgery at the End of Life
